abstract: A Boolean value that indicates when the user is searching.
overview:
## Discussion

You can read this value like any of the other [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/EnvironmentValues], by creating a property with the [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/Environment] property wrapper:

Get the value to find out when the user interacts with a search field that’s produced by one of the searchable modifiers, like [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/View/searchable(text:placement:prompt:)]:

When the user first taps or clicks in a search field, the `isSearching` property becomes `true`. When the user cancels the search operation, the property becomes `false`. To programmatically set the value to `false` and dismiss the search operation, use [doc://com.apple.SwiftUI/documentation/SwiftUI/EnvironmentValues/dismissSearch].
